content.description:
Start is at base of Tower 3 same as Left Rib.  First pitch requires gear anchor to left of Left Rib after first bolt above notch and at a nice standing belay to left of midpoint rap anchors of Left Rib.

Second Pitch is well-protected with a hard gear finish.  Start second pitch in chimney/corner between Left Wall and Tower 3.

 Third pitch tops out from back right side of "diving board" feature at top of second pitch—going to summit of Tower 3.

 The crux is very heady and delicate, but the gear is solid!
content.protection: .2 to 3 inches with several bolts.  Can be well protected.  Only the second pitch requires gear--other than the gear anchor at top of pitch one.
content.location:
Start first pitch as with Left Rib but exit tower to left midway up after the bolt above the notch and below the midpoint rap anchors.  This requires a gear anchor.  

 Second pitch is about 15 feet back in a left facing corner (just left of Cracked Rib) with a chimney that allows access to a line of bolts to get established on the pitch.  The pitch finishes on a bolted anchor on the end of the "Diving Board" feature that sticks out into space--left of Left Rib and above.

 The third pitch goes up the back wall from the "Diving Board" to the summit of Tower 3.

content.description: To the left of Right Rib on the same face. Lower face has a bolt ~12 up ... felt harder than 5.7, looks like there may have been some breakage. Climb face to horizontal, then up to small roof. Clear roof to the left, clip bolt and climb to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts + gear. Same top anchors as Right Rib

content.description: Start is same as Ergone but traverses right toward and into chimney instead of going straight up at the head wall above horizontal crack and after first bolt on that wall. Psychological crux is stemming out and transitioning into the chimney. Finishes on left arete after 15 feet of chimney climbing straight up.
content.protection: After fourth bolt, traverse up toward right side of wall and clip a bolt at small ledge just under the chimney.  Bolt on far side of chimney. Next bolt is on left arete above chimney.  Use  alpine draws at the bolts below and in chimney to reduce/eliminate rope drag.
content.location: Right of Ergone (route E) and left of Spinal Nerve (route C) on lower tier of left rib of Sven Tower III.  Can scramble off right at top or go to excellent second tier climbs which finish on top of the tower.  Rap anchors at every level.

content.description: Ascends a nice right leaning hand crack up an initially steep wall that gradually eases.  Take the leftward horizontal crack to another small crack above, past a bolt, then scramble to the anchors for left rib climbs.
content.protection: A bolt is present to assist getting to the crack across a steep slab.  Another one is at the top of the crack system to aid rope management from the anchors.
content.location: Midway between the left and right ribs of Sven Tower 3.  Route C on the posted topo.

content.description: Crux is from the start to about the middle of the climb when the jams get easier, bigger, and the feet get a bit better.  There is some rock in the crack that could break loose with hard pulling in a certain direction, but with finesse, the climb is pretty solid--thus the PG-13 rating.
content.protection: Finger-size to 3 or 4 inches near the top.  One bolt at the base of the climb to assist getting safely into the protectable part of the crack. Can easily be top-roped by leading Backbone or rapping in from above.
content.location: On the large block between Left and Right Rib just right of Spinal Block.

content.description: Crux is moving above the 3rd bolt through to 5th bolt.  Spicy traverse from 2nd to 3rd bolt but grade is lower in that section, feet are good, and  a fall would be clean.
content.protection: Five quick draws and some small to medium gear to protect to the first bolt is optional. Can easily be top-roped by leading Backbone or rapping in from above.
content.location: This climb is in the middle of the block on lower Sven 3 between Left and Right Ribs--between Dermatome (to the left) and Spinal Cracker (to the right).

content.description: Right of Baby Back and Left of the gully that separates the Left Rib of Sven 3 from the Spare Rib section.  Start on steep slab just left of the right arete--from top of boulder past two shallow horizontal cracks and left of a large free standing boulder to a steep wall with two separate crack sections, one low and left--and the other high and right.
content.protection: Gear is small to medium (.4 to 2 inches).
content.location: Spare Rib is the furthest left section of granite making up the left wall of the gully to the left of the left rib of Sven 3.  Start low and left near the middle of the rib where a vertical crack system can be seen from below.

content.description: Same start as Plaque Attack until first bolt, then up left side of tooth feature past two more bolts, then over tooth and to the summit. Climbing straight through the bolt line without stepping right midway through the tooth feature--at the upward facing flake--increases the difficulty (and fun) to the 5.9 range.
content.protection: 1 piton and 3 bolts.  A horizontal crack toward the top protects Nicely with a big blue C4.  Two sets of anchors at top, one with rap rings.
content.location: Right of Plaque Attack on upper tier of Sven III.

content.description: Crux is the first step up after clipping the first bolt--above horizontal.  Direct start to the Shark Tooth formation up past a bolt to hidden piton on climber's left in upward facing flake on front of tooth.  Can be viewed from below far left at shelf level before clipping first bolt.  Then continue up as with Shark Tooth.
content.protection: Two pitons and two bolts.  The pitons, while slightly rusted, are solidly placed and confidence-inspiring.  Alpine draw for pitons better to avoid drag.
content.location: Same start as with Plaque Attack and Shark Tooth, then step around front of tooth carefully before clipping first bolt.

content.description: Good solid rock past two bolts to first pitch crux - a semi off-width chimney easily protected.    Second pitch is short past two bolts and great belay station.    Third pitch goes across the chasm to the left and up the obvious Y-shaped crack above.    Move across the ramp leading up - you can sling the horn and then up two moves to the top anchors.
content.location: First obvious climb at the base of the tower

content.description: Above the second piton the rock gets a bit hollow sounding.  Gear placements available to get to top, but rock quality is suspect in places.  No flaking loose rock--just hollow sounding sections.
content.protection: two pitons and 1 bolt.  Gear preferable to get through crux and also to top out.  .3 inch to 3 inch recommended--small rack.  Two sets of anchors at top--one with rap rings.
content.location: Above and behind the first tier climb top anchors and to the Left of the easy crack climb (Head) that leads to summit of Sven III.  Can be reached from left or right with careful scrambling on left and annoying crawling through tight spot on right.

content.description: The crux will hit you after the second bolt - the gap before the arete can be backed up with a Alien or cam but beware of your rope getting sucked up into the seam above... its sharp and I would not want to take a whipper sawing into that.    Higher up there are some solid slab moves ... be prepared for the 7+ move.
content.protection: Bolts and a cam to protect the arete move to bolt
content.location: Past first obvious slab, in a culvert

content.description: There is no specific crux. It is a nice easy 5.5 crack. Both the right and left crack are about the same in difficultly.
content.protection: I single rack of cams and nuts
content.location: It is the Y-crack to the right of Shark Attack.

content.description: Climb a slab past a few bolts to a horizontal crack then up the vertical face with a couple of jugs to a second vertical face. Then it's friction climbing to the top. 70m single rap barely makes it or 2 60m raps with intermediate rap station.
content.protection: Bolts with a couple of hand-sized pieces
content.location: Route E on the posted topo. 3rd slab you come to on the approach. The bolt line that is on the right

content.description: Right of Backbone on a steep featured vertical face.  Sustained through three bolts and eases off a bit near the top.
content.protection: Three bolts with rap anchors at the top. Can easily be top-roped by leading Backbone or rapping in from above.
content.location: Between the left and right ribs of Sven Tower 3 on the bottom tier.  Scramble right from the base of the trail right before it goes up the rocks to the Left Rib belay area.  Just right of route D on the posted topo (but not listed).

content.description: Can be done as variation of left rib by stepping into gulley below midpoint rap anchors and climbing cracks on right wall of gully to anchors at top of left rib.
Ascends the Southeast arête of the large Boulder that sits between the left and right ribs of Sven Tower 3.
content.protection: Three bolts with gear options available to get to the first bolt--as needed.  There is a newish anchor at the top with rap rings.
content.location: Midway between the right and left rib on the lower tier of the tower.  The climb ascends the left arête with a traverse across the top of the boulder to reach the next level climb(Spinal Nerve).

content.description: Slightly awkward start up a slab with a crack running up the middle of the Spare Rib formation (left of left rib).  First pro goes between large boulder to left and slab below crack.  Follow crack up and left to bypass steep wall, instead passing a single bolt on the arête and up to the anchor ledge.
content.protection: Medium gear past a bolt to rap anchor with ring.
content.location:
Slab left of left rib.  Start low and left against a large Boulder in the middle of the formation.  Rap anchors at the top in a small sheltered ledge near the top of the formation-- before the crumbling boulders on top.  Good rock quality to the top! 

  Note: go left near top and follow easier terrain above horizontal.  Direct finish is much harder that 5.5.  Bolt is above the horizontal on left arête.

content.description: Great long mixed routes on good rock. East facing, looking out over Verde Valley, and Fountain Hills.
